conclusion: Velocity-time graphs show direction and speed of objects over time.
Object A's velocity-time graph starts at origin, increases to maximum, then decreases to zero.
Object B's velocity-time graph starts at origin, increases to maximum, then decreases to zero.
Difference in speed is the absolute difference between maximum velocities of objects A and B.
Analyze if difference in speed between objects A and B increases continuously over time interval.
Since maximum velocities increase continuously, difference in speed also increases continuously.
Difference in speed between objects A and B is continuously increasing.
